abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column tells story of Oscar Robertson, star point guard at Crispus Attucks High School in Indianapolis in 1950s who helped team become first Indiana State champion from all-black school; applauds Robertson's inclusiveness and generosity as he agrees to be grand marshal at Indianapolis 500 auto race only if his entire team and cheerleaders are invited, too.
lead_paragraph: Saturday’s parade for the Indy 500, for which Robertson is a grand marshal, will stop at Monument Circle to give the all-black Crispus Attucks basketball team the celebration it was denied in 1955.

headline.main: A Tribute to Oscar Robertson’s High School Team, 60 Years Overdue
headline.print_headline: Tribute to a Star’s Team, 60 Years Overdue

snippet: Saturday’s parade for the Indy 500, for which Robertson is a grand marshal, will stop at Monument Circle to give the all-black Crispus Attucks basketball team the celebration it was denied in 1955.
